intro: Jupunba alexandri var. alexandri, commonly known as the Alexandrian jupunba, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a distinctive silvery or grayish hue. The flowers, which appear in late spring, are small and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
